file_content.text: Moff Yurrion sends his gratitude.
My lord, Moff Yurrion wants to see you.
Mercenary. Moff Yurrion wants to congratulate you.
Sir, Moff Yurrion is on his way.
My heroes.
My hero.
The Mandalorians have fallen into place, the Sand People tribes are scattered... it's a new dawn for Tatooine.
Troops and supplies will move freely under mercenary protection. Our garrison will purge Exchange corruption and act as a beacon of stability.
This backwater planet might be useful after all.
There's hope for Tatooine yet.
Who'd have expected?
I doubt the Jedi and the Republic will let this sector fall.
What if the Republic objects?
If they move against us, we'll protect ourselves--but I doubt they see the potential I do.
This isn't the first planet I've handed to the Empire.
Nothing I haven't done before.
But it's the first time you've brought civilization to these barbaric reaches of the galaxy.
Of course, we've already begun raiding Exchange bases to take advantage of their vulnerability.
We've seized credit chips, antiquities, spice--to be stored in my personal vaults until they can be processed by Imperial authorities.
Take everything from the criminals. It's the only way to destroy their organization.
Bleed the Exchange dry.
We think the same, you and I--but strategy isn't what we should discuss.
The seized goods deserve to be shared. Walk away from Tatooine with pockets full, and remember my aid.
Shouldn't seized credits go to the Empire, instead of your personal accounts?
That doesn't sound legit.
I'm only holding them temporarily; you're missing the point.
I sweat and bleed to destroy the Exchange, and you're the one who profits?
You're now rich because of me!
You misunderstand me. I'm not telling you this to gloat.
I'm telling you because I want to share with my friends. Walk away from Tatooine with pockets full, and remember my aid.
Tatooine is yours, thanks to me. It's only right we both reap the rewards.
Agreed--we all profit here.
There was never any doubt.
You'll find your ship refueled and re-armed with my compliments. I look forward to seeing your mark on other worlds.
Uplink to the minister is ready for you, sir.
I have to go--but whatever you do? Don't let Darth Baras get in the way of a promising Sith like yourself.
I have other business--but whatever you do, don't let Darth Zash take her apprentice for granted. You have potential to go far.
I must go--but give my regards to Keeper. And whatever happens, don't let him shift the blame for his performance to you.
Good luck, bounty hunter. If the rumors about that competition of yours are true, you will need it.
I wish you well in your travels. Do return someday.
Your corruption won't stand.
You overestimate your importance. My master will learn of your disloyalty.
Intelligence doesn't smile on those who steal from the Empire. What do you say I tell Keeper about this?
I may not be Imperial, but I'm no fool. How about I mention your "business" to the Sith?
That's altogether unnecessary, I... only want the best for the Empire. I'll expedite the transfer of my goods to acquisitions, with apologies.
I'll begin work on that immediately, sir.
Yes... please do.
I should return to business, but I promise you've left Tatooine in good hands. I look forward to seeing your mark on other worlds.
No one survives the journey to the Mandalorian village.
Target sighted. Sweep the area and escort the package.
If you'll remain where you are, my lord.
Stay where you are, sir.
Don't go anywhere, bounty hunter.
Make way for Moff Yurrion!
So much fuss over a walk to the spaceport--you'd think I'd break my own neck without a bodyguard.
I'm Merile Yurrion, overseer of this sector. I trust your visit has been both enjoyable and productive?
A Jedi Master has been training students in the desert. I came to deal with him.
I was sent after a Jedi.
Well, my lord, I hope he didn't spoil the atmosphere for you.
You have as many criminals buried in the desert as you do artifacts. Truly, a wealth of discoveries.
I've had an interesting time.
Well put, my lord.
I came to handle a terrorist threat. Imperial Intelligence sends its regards.
Things went well, sir.
Pity Keeper can't be here himself--he and I didn't part under the best of circumstances--but I'm sure you're more open-minded.
I'm still alive; my targets aren't. I'd call that a win.
I came out ahead.
Your Intelligence profile doesn't do you justice. Let's talk.
I won't be coming back for pleasure. Or at all, if I can help it.
Frankly, I'm ready to leave.
I'm sorry to hear that, especially when I'm so grateful for your help civilizing this planet.
Do you plan to hold me here, Moff?
Explain yourself, now!
You wound me--I merely wanted to thank you for all the good you've done
Tatooine may not be prestigious, but it is useful--we've hosted everything from archaeological digs to weapons testing facilities.
A clean slate means opportunity. Imagine Imperial Tatooine as a bulwark against the Republic and underworld corruption throughout the Outer Rim.
With enough manpower, it's possible. But Tatooine is far from achieving your dream.
You have ambitious goals.
Not as far as you think.
"Corruption" is just business the Empire doesn't control.
The underworld has uses.
I'm not advocating the elimination of every criminal syndicate--only the ones who refuse to see reason.
Crime syndicates run half this planet already. You mean to turn that around?
The underworld's already here.
Eliminate the disease, and the symptoms will fade.
Concerned that your assignment guarding a lifeless desert doesn't suit a man of your "stature"?
You sound pathetic.
What makes a Moff is his ability to turn any assignment to the Empire's advantage.
Intentionally or not, you've already struck blows to the Exchange, the Sand People tribes and others.
You have unfinished business, and before you leave, I'm offering you a part in this sector's subjugation.
There's a lot of work ahead, and my time is limited. What's our first priority?
Where do we start?
"Subjugation" doesn't pay my bills.
Are you offering money?
Credits will, I presume.
When the Minister of War honors your accomplishments, you'll have me to thank. Understood?
You'll owe me, you know.
The Empire will have you to thank, but I'll show my gratitude. Shall we begin?
And if I'm not interested in your "offer"?
Suppose I say "no."
Why, we walk away--we're not barbarians, so hear me out.
Without an Imperial legion, we need unconventional allies to secure territory--and the local Mandalorian mercenaries are legendary.
I've opened relations and posted officers in their settlement--but the Mandalorians must also learn to respect us. You can arrange that.
You want a message sent to the Mandalorians. Tell me how.
I can put them in their place.
I've heard the term "Mandalorian," but I'm not familiar with the people.
Mandalorians?
A high-tech warrior culture, eager to fight and often for hire. One of their clans settled here.
I've worked with the Mandalorians before. I didn't know there were any on Tatooine.
Who are the Mandalorians here?
It's a smaller clan--they've taken contracts with the Hutts in recent years, but they proved themselves during the war.
You don't even have the strength to secure this planet yourself.
You're relying on mercenaries?
Because troops are in limited supply--would you rather do nothing?
The Mandalorians use the wastelands outside their village as a training ground--if you survive the passage, they'll be forced to acknowledge you.
But retrieve the corpses of their initiates who died in the wastes, drop their own dead at their feet and they'll be forced to see you as a challenge.
I'll prove to the Mandalorians that I can survive what they couldn't.
Agreed--it's a plan.
If we humiliate the Mandalorians, they'll only turn on us.
Goading them won't help.
Not if we humiliate them by their customs.
If we eliminate the worst of the troublemakers, the rest will fall into line.
I'd rather just kill them.
Starting a blood feud with the Mandalorians is not to our advantage.
Put them in their place and help my men, and our conquest can begin.
Sir--Colonel Gorik is waiting to report.
If you'll excuse me--but think on what I've said. Work with me, and the rewards will be magnificent.
Move along, in the name of Moff Yurrion!
